019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.util.Arrays;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.HashMap;
025import java.util.LinkedList;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.Map;
028import java.util.Objects;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.Set;
031import java.util.function.Function;
032import java.util.stream.Collectors;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
035import org.jgrapes.core.ComponentFactory;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
038import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
039import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
040import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
041
042/**
043 * Provides child components dynamically using {@link ComponentFactory}s.
044 * 
045 * An instance is configured with a collection of {@link ComponentFactory}s
046 * (see {@link #setFactories(ComponentFactory...)}) and component 
047 * configurations (see {@link #setPinned(List)} and 
048 * {@link #onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate)}). For each 
049 * configuration where the referenced factory exists, a component is 
050 * created and attached to this component provider as child.
051 * 
052 * The component configurations can be updated by
053 * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events.
054 * 
055 * @since 1.3
056 */
057@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
058public class ComponentProvider extends Component {
059
060    /** The entry name for the component's type. */
061    public static final String COMPONENT_TYPE = "componentType";
062    /** The entry name for the component's name. */
063    public static final String COMPONENT_NAME = "name";
064
065    private String componentsEntry = "components";
066    private Map<String, ComponentFactory> factoryByType
067        = Collections.emptyMap();
068    private List<Map<Object, Object>> currentConfig = Collections.emptyList();
069    private List<Map<Object, Object>> pinnedConfigurations
070        = Collections.emptyList();
071
072    /**
073     * Creates a new component with its channel set to this object. 
074     */
075    public ComponentProvider() {
076        this(Channel.SELF);
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Creates a new component with its channel set to the given 
081     * channel. 
082     *
083     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
084     * handlers listen on by default and that 
085     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
086     */
087    public ComponentProvider(Channel componentChannel) {
088        super(componentChannel);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Sets the name of the entry in a {@link ConfigurationUpdate} event,
093     * that holds the information about the components to be provided.
094     * Defaults to "components". 
095     * 
096     * If set to `null`, handling {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events 
097     * is effectively disabled (unless 
098     * {@link #componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate)}
099     * is overridden by a method that ignores the setting).
100     *
101     * @param name the name of the entry
102     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
103     */
104    public ComponentProvider setComponentsEntry(String name) {
105        this.componentsEntry = name;
106        return this;
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Sets the factories that this provider knows about. Only
111     * configurations with a component type that matches one
112     * of the factories are handled by this provider.
113     *
114     * @param factories the factories
115     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
116     */
117    public ComponentProvider setFactories(ComponentFactory... factories) {
118        factoryByType = Arrays.stream(factories).collect(Collectors
119            .toMap(f -> f.componentType().getName(), Function.identity(),
120                (a, b) -> b));
121        synchronize(currentConfig);
122        return this;
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Gets the factories.
127     *
128     * @return the factories
129     */
130    public Collection<ComponentFactory> factories() {
131        return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(factoryByType.values());
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Sets the pinned configurations. Components provided due to
136     * these configurations exist independent of any information passed by
137     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events.
138     *
139     * @param pinnedConfigurations the configurations to be pinned
140     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
141     */
142    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
143    public ComponentProvider setPinned(List<Map<?, ?>> pinnedConfigurations) {
144        this.pinnedConfigurations
145            = Collections.unmodifiableList(pinnedConfigurations.stream()
146                .map(c -> Collections
147                    .unmodifiableMap(new HashMap<>((Map<Object, Object>) c)))
148                .collect(Collectors.toList()));
149        synchronize(currentConfig);
150        return this;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Gets the pinned configurations.
155     *
156     * @return the pinned configurations
157     */
158    public List<Map<Object, Object>> pinned() {
159        return pinnedConfigurations;
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Selects configuration information targeted at this component
164     * from the event. The default implementation invokes 
165     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate#structured(String)} with this
166     * component's path to obtain the information. Called by 
167     * {@link #componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate)}.
168     *
169     * @param evt the event
170     * @return the configuration information as provided by
171     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate#structured(String)} if it exists
172     */
173    protected Optional<Map<String, ?>>
174            providerConfiguration(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
175        return evt.structured(componentPath());
176    }
177
178    /**
179     * Returns the configurations for the components to be provided.
180     * Overriding this method enables derived classes to fully 
181     * control how this information is retrieved from the
182     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} event.
183     * 
184     * This implementation of the method calls 
185     * {@link #componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate)} to obtain
186     * all configuration information targeted at this component.
187     * It then uses the configured entry 
188     * (see {@link #setComponentsEntry(String)}) to retrieve the information
189     * about the components to be provided.
190     * 
191     * The method must ensure that the result is a collection
192     * of maps, where each map has at least entries with
193     * keys "componentType" and "name", each associated with a
194     * value of type {@link String}.
195     * 
196     * @param evt the event
197     * @return the collection
198     */
199    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals")
200    protected List<Map<Object, Object>>
201            componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
202        if (componentsEntry == null) {
203            // Shortcut, avoids call to provider configuration.
204            return Collections.emptyList();
205        }
206        return providerConfiguration(evt)
207            .map(conf -> conf.get(componentsEntry))
208            .filter(Collection.class::isInstance).map(c -> (Collection<?>) c)
209            .orElse(Collections.emptyList()).stream()
210            .filter(Map.class::isInstance).map(c -> (Map<?, ?>) c)
211            .filter(c -> c.keySet()
212                .containsAll(Set.of(COMPONENT_TYPE, COMPONENT_NAME))
213                && String.class.isInstance(c.get(COMPONENT_TYPE))
214                && String.class.isInstance(c.get(COMPONENT_NAME)))
215            .map(c -> {
216                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") // Checked for relevant entries
217                var casted = (Map<Object, Object>) c;
218                return casted;
219            })
220            .collect(Collectors.toList());
221    }
222
223    /**
224     * Uses the information from the event to configure the
225     * provided components.
226     * 
227     * @param evt the event
228     */
229    @Handler
230    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
231        synchronize(componentConfigurations(evt));
232    }
233
234    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidSynchronizedAtMethodLevel")
235    private synchronized void synchronize(List<Map<Object, Object>> requested) {
236        // Calculate starters for to be added/to be removed
237        var toBeAdded = new LinkedList<>(requested);
238        toBeAdded.addAll(pinnedConfigurations);
239        var toBeRemoved = children().stream()
240            .map(c -> Components.manager(c))
241            .collect(Collectors.toCollection(LinkedList::new));
242
243        // Don't attempt to add something that we have no factory for.
244        toBeAdded = toBeAdded.stream()
245            .filter(c -> factoryByType.containsKey(c.get(COMPONENT_TYPE)))
246            .collect(Collectors.toCollection(LinkedList::new));
247
248        // Remove the intersection of "to be added" and "to be removed" from
249        // both, thus leaving what their names say.
250        for (var childIter = toBeRemoved.iterator();
251                childIter.hasNext();) {
252            var child = childIter.next();
253            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
254            var childComp = child.component().getClass().getName();
255            var childName = child.name();
256            for (var confIter = toBeAdded.iterator();
257                    confIter.hasNext();) {
258                var config = confIter.next();
259                var confComp = config.get(COMPONENT_TYPE);
260                var confName = config.get(COMPONENT_NAME);
261                if (confComp.equals(childComp)
262                    && Objects.equals(childName, confName)) {
263                    confIter.remove();
264                    childIter.remove();
265                }
266            }
267        }
268
269        // Update children
270        for (var child : toBeRemoved) {
271            child.detach();
272        }
273        toBeAdded.stream().map(config -> {
274            return factoryByType.get(config.get(COMPONENT_TYPE))
275                .create(channel(), config).map(
276                    c -> ComponentFactory.setStandardProperties(c, config))
277                .stream();
278        }).flatMap(Function.identity())
279            .forEach(component -> attach(component));
280
281        // Save configuration as current
282        currentConfig = requested;
283    }
284
285}
